newsitem.title: USA: BPA Sat power prices unchanged, Mon off-peak lower.
newsitem.headline: BPA Sat power prices unchanged, Mon off-peak lower.

text.p: The Bonneville Power Administration left next-day price offers unchanged for Saturday, while lowering Sunday prices as well as off-peak offers for Monday, the federal agency said on Friday.

For Saturday, firm deliveries to both the Northwest and California-Oregon (COB) and Nevada-Oregon (NOB) borders during a block of light-load hours were offered at $17.00 per megawatt hour (MWh), compared with $16.00 per MWh on Sunday and Monday.
Firm power during heavy-load hours was offered at $18.00 (Northwest) and $19.50 (COB/NOB) for both Saturday and Monday and at $17.25 and $18.00, respectively, for Sunday.
BPA offered non-firm power between 0100 and 0500 PDT on Monday at $16.00 per MWh, down from $17.00 for Friday preschedulings.
Monday prices for non-firm power between 0700 and 2300 PDT were unchanged from Friday's at $18.50 (Northwest) and $20.00 (COB/NOB).
